sample

Class FileWrapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • sample.FileWrapper
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class FileWrapper
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Class used to wrap and send SMALL files via sockets. byte[] is not a proper structure that should be used to read large files
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      java.lang.String[] perms
      Array of permissions to this sent file
      java.lang.String relativePath
      Relative path of sent file

    • Constructor Detail

      • FileWrapper

        public FileWrapper(java.lang.String owner,
                   java.lang.String relativePath,
                   java.lang.String mainFolder)
        Client side constructor
        Parameters:
        owner - owner of file
        relativePath - relative path of file
        mainFolder - local folder used for retrieving content from actual file if not given no content will be provided

      • FileWrapper

        public FileWrapper(java.lang.String owner,
                   java.lang.String relativePath,
                   java.lang.String mainFolder,
                   java.lang.Integer discNumber)
        Server side constructor
        Parameters:
        owner - owner of file
        relativePath - relative path of file
        mainFolder - local folder used for retrieving content from actual file if not given no content will be provided
        discNumber - disc number where file is located

      • FileWrapper

                   java.lang.String relativePath,

        Client side constructor
        Parameters:
        owner - owner of file
        relativePath - relative path of file
        mainFolder - local folder used for retrieving content from actual file if not given no content will be provided
        perms - permissions given to file

      • FileWrapper

        public FileWrapper(java.lang.String owner,

      • FileWrapper

        public FileWrapper(java.nio.file.Path filePath,
                   java.lang.Integer discNumber)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Server side constructor used with absolute path of file
        Parameters:
        filePath - path of file
        discNumber - disc number where file is located
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown when file could not be read
